sessions.title: Workshop Day Registration and Breakfast
GraphQL For Frontend Developers
sessions.description:
There are many advantages to using GraphQL as a datasource for frontend development, compared to REST APIs. We developers in example need to write a lot of imperative code to retrieve data to display in our applications and handle state. With GraphQL you cannot only decrease the amount of code needed around data fetching and state-management you'll also get increased flexibility, better performance and most of all an improved developer experience. In this workshop you'll learn how GraphQL can improve your work as a frontend developer and how to handle GraphQL in your frontend React application.

Contents:
- Getting started with GraphQL
- GraphQL Queries
- Mutating Data
- GraphQL in React
- Using a GraphQL Client
- Autogenerating Code with TypeScript

sessions.title: Lessons Learned from 7 Years in React
sessions.description: This workshop explores a long list of lessons learned from working in React for the last 7 years. Tips include rethinking separation of concerns, selecting state management approaches, types vs propTypes, performance optimizations, form optimizations, novel workflows, utilizing mock APIs, automated testing strategies, and patterns for sharing components.

sessions.title: Using TailwindCSS to Make Stellar UI
sessions.description:
Join us in this Tailwind Extravaganza! You will have the chance to upgrade multiple demo apps and compete for prizes while learning UI/UX skills, Tailwind concepts, and component library integration strategies throughout the workshop. We’ll begin by ensuring everyone is up-to-speed and ready to conquer UI with some CSS and UI basics, then go from there! Each segment will have challenges and hands-on coding assignments for you to try your hand at.

Concepts We’ll Cover

Tailwind Intro

    What is Tailwind?
    Utility First vs Others
    When Tailwind isn’t the solution.
    Getting Started with Tailwind in your Angular Apps

Basics

Reusable Styles

Spacing Elements

Responsive Design

    Flexbox
    Grid
    Layouts with Tailwind
    Media Queries

An Animated Tailwind

    Handling Hover, Focus, and Other States
    States (:hover) & Pseudo Selectors (:visited)
    Transforms, Transitions, & Animations

Custom Styles

    Arbitrary Values
    Customizing with the Tailwind Config file
        Adjusting the scale of font sizes, providing color themes and more!

Functions & Directives


Tailwind Plugins (Forms)

Component Libraries & Tailwind

    Integrating Kendo UI with Tailwind 
    How Tailwind Layers with Your Custom Branding and Style Systems

Production Ready

Wrap Up

    Resources & Prize Winners party popper

sessions.title: Leadership Workshop for the Reluctant Leader
sessions.description:
Does the idea of being a leader terrify you? Are you in a leadership role today and not sure you're cut out for it, or feel like you're not leading effectively? This workshop is for you!

SPOILER ALERT: You don't even need to be in a leadership position to be an effective leader!

In this workshop, we will explore the critical ingredients of good leadership. We'll bust some myths, learn to lead ourselves, and recognize areas where we can take responsibility or take action. Along the way, we'll explore strategies for common tough subjects such as conflict resolution, influencing others, running effective meetings, and public speaking!

I promise you will walk away with a fresh perspective on leadership, excited about your potential, and equipped with tools to help you reach your full potential and have a lasting positive impact on others!

sessions.title: CI/CD workshop for front-end projects
sessions.description:
In this full day, hands-on workshop, we'll take a Web project from start to automated deployment. We will discuss CI pipelines and how it helps to find issues faster and speeds the development process. We'll look at tools to make CI pipelines run faster, and also how they are used on a team of people. Of course, we'll go hands-on and configure and run a CI build.
Along the way we'll:
* Discuss CI / CD concepts
* Discuss Git concepts to build a successful pipeline
* integrate testing
* talk about npm caching and other things to speed up the work
* how to use a good build for deployment to production
* a survey of CI tools

A laptop is required for this workshop.

sessions.title: Testing React apps with React Testing Library and Cypress
sessions.description:
In this full day, hands-on workshop, we will cover React Testing Library and Cypress for building out comprehensive testing for React applications.
Bring your laptop!
We'll start withs some basic concepts, and do hands-on exercises to help you understand everything you need to know. Please come with your questions about testing your React app, and we'll cover how to apply testing tools and fundamentals so you apply your knowledge and be a rockstar at work!
